laboratory_examinations.findings: Total retinal detachment with no evidence of calcification.
Larger retinal vessels are dilated and tortuous; extensive telangiectasia and microaneurysms present. Fluorescein leaks into plaques early in dye transit.
Visual acuity of light perception in right eye and 20/15 in the left eye; intraocular pressures were 17 mm Hg in the right eye and 15 mm Hg in the left eye.
A few hard exudates and lipid crystals in and under the retina; a large area of creamy-white opacification in the inferior peripheral retina.
